samples.context: Symptoms include painful muscular spasms especially of neck and jaw. Lock jaw condition occurs when the patient cannot open the mouth.
samples.question: What are the symptoms of tetanus?

samples.context: Lock jaw condition occurs when the patient cannot open the mouth. Convulsions and paralysis of muscles, difficulty in chewing and swallowing, fever and headache are the other symptoms.
samples.question: What happens during the lock jaw condition?

samples.context: Symptoms include painful muscular spasms especially of neck and jaw. Convulsions and paralysis of muscles, difficulty in chewing and swallowing, fever and headache are the other symptoms.
samples.question: What additional symptoms can occur in tetanus?

samples.context: Convulsions and paralysis of muscles, difficulty in chewing and swallowing, fever and headache are the other symptoms.
samples.question: What difficulties might a tetanus patient face?

samples.context: Painful muscular spasms especially of neck and jaw. Lock jaw condition occurs when the patient cannot open the mouth.
